page.title: 03BURY FARM
page.content: BURY FARM HAS BELONGED TO THE WOOTTON FAMILY SINCE OCT.18TH 1749.THE FARMHOUSE ORIGINALLY BELONGED TO THE SHUTTLEWORTH ESTATE. THE FARM IS IN THE PATH OF ONE OF THE PROPOSED ROUTES FOR THE NEW BEDFORD BYPASS.IF THIS ROUTE IS FINALLY SELECTED MR.WOOTTON WILL MOVE WITH ALL HIS LIVESTOCK TO HIS OTHER FARM AT RAVENSDEN. AT PRESENT THE 550 ACRE FARM EMPLOYS 6 PEOPLE. CEREAL AND POTATOES ARE GROWN AND THERE IS A HERD OF HEREFORD COWS WITH ONE HEREFORD BULL.PHEASANTS ARE REARED AND THERE ARE A NUMBER OF BROOD MARES. FARM MACHINERY INCLUDES 10 TRACTORS,A COMBINE HARVESTERAND A PLOUGH.WATER IS HEATED BY A HOME-MADE BOILER MADE OF 2 OLD OIL DRUMS AND SOME COPPER PIPING. THE SOIL IS HEAVY CLAY.
